examQuestions.question: What is the key difference between Christian coaching and biblical counseling?
options: Coaching focuses on future action and growth, counseling addresses past wounds
Coaching uses only the New Testament
examQuestions.explanation: Christian coaching is forward-focused ‚Äî helping clients set goals and take action aligned with faith. Biblical counseling typically addresses healing from past wounds and deeper emotional issues.

examQuestions.question: What does the 'R' in the G.R.A.C.E. Method‚Ñ¢ stand for?
examQuestions.explanation: The 'R' stands for 'Reveal the Calling' ‚Äî helping clients uncover their God-given purpose and unique gifts they've been entrusted with.

examQuestions.question: Why is charging for Christian coaching consistent with biblical principles?
options: The Bible says nothing about money
1 Timothy 5:18 says the worker deserves their wages ‚Äî your gift has value
You should always coach for free
examQuestions.explanation: Scripture affirms that workers deserve compensation. Charging for coaching honors the gift God gave you and allows you to sustain your ministry long-term.

examQuestions.explanation: Proverbs 27:17 ‚Äî 'As iron sharpens iron, so one person sharpens another' ‚Äî is the foundational scripture for the coaching relationship.

examQuestions.question: In the G.R.A.C.E. Method‚Ñ¢, what is the purpose of the 'Cultivate' step?

examQuestions.explanation: The 'Cultivate' step builds Christ-centered accountability structures rooted in community, prayer, and spiritual disciplines ‚Äî going deeper than willpower alone.

faq.q: Is this only for pastors or ministry leaders?
faq.a: Not at all. This is for any believer who feels called to help others grow in purpose and faith ‚Äî whether you're in formal ministry or not.

faq.q: Does this replace seminary or biblical counseling training?
faq.a: No. This is coaching certification, not counseling or pastoral training. Many graduates combine this with existing ministry or counseling credentials.

faq.q: Can I charge for faith-based coaching?
faq.a: Absolutely. Scripture is clear that workers deserve their wages (1 Timothy 5:18). Charging allows you to sustain your ministry and serve more people.
